While watching each historical photo carefully, the heart is full of respect for the soldiers who went to the Korean War.

We went to the military demarcation line 24 kilometers south of the 38th Line, which is what we usually call Panmendian. This may be our "major play" in North Korea this time. Unfortunately, in several buildings, we did not see "five-star red flag" nor the traces of the volunteers. It seems that the great achievements of "anti-American and aid to North Korea" are being forgotten. But we didn't make a fuss. We also felt the same way in Vietnam. In Hanoi Museum, we can't see any trace of China "Anti-American and Aid Vietnam". The world has only common interests, no common goals and "everything is in the silence".

For the Chinese, they do not know the volunteer army, do not know that there are not many people who resist the United States and aid the DPRK, unless they are still small and have no historical knowledge. When I went to North Korea to travel, I didn’t go to Panmunjom. I just wanted to see how the volunteer army fish and the Korean side negotiated with the US ghosts. It backfired. Today’s Panmunjom is not ordinary. The original volunteer army has not been opened at all. Or, how can I not even have a photo? The Korean War was fought by North Korea itself, and nothing happened to China without us? So what do we see?

The 38 line we are talking about actually lies in the territory of North Korea. A certain distance south is the real military demarcation line. In Kaesong, we visited the place where the Korean War was negotiated and signed. The atmosphere on the streets of Kaesong is more serious than that of Pyongyang and closer to the Chinese street scenery of the 1970s. In Panmenge, you can see the South Korean Liberty Pavilion opposite. In Korea, you can't shoot soldiers at will, but there are soldiers in Panmenge who can take photos together.

Panmundian is located in the central and western part of the Korean Peninsula, 5 kilometers south of the 38° line north latitude. It was a small place that was previously unknown. On July 27, 1953, the Korean Armistice Agreement was signed here, and Panmundian became famous.

The car traveled 168 kilometers from Pyongyang to Panmunjom. This small village, 8 kilometers southeast of Kaicheng District of Korea, is famous for its signature of the Korean Armistice Agreement on July 27, 1953, and is now the site of the Special Committee for Liaison between the two Koreas. Led by an officer of the Korean People's Army, we began our tour. First, before the map of Korea and the schematic map of Panmunjom's location, the officer who served as the explainer briefly introduced the general situation of the armistice line and Panmunjom. Then he traveled on the road with wire mesh isolation and arrived at the North Korean Armistice Negotiation and Signature Site on the north side of the armistice line. After getting off the bus, the first thing you can see is the Korean flag tower which stands high over the roadside crops. Then you can see the Korean flag tower which echoes the Korean flag tower. It is said that this is the unique landscape of Panmunjom. The flag tower of South Korea is 100 meters high, while that of North Korea is 160 meters high. The flag length is 30 meters, which is known as the world's first. It has been seen in the newspapers and periodicals that the two Koreas had gone through a series of comparisons in the height of the two flag towers, competing for each other before giving in. In the end, North Korea took the lead with its "fearlessness" heroism at no economic cost. Under the leadership of the officers, we visited the negotiation room first. A very ordinary board room was situated in a clean environment decorated with green trees and flowers. Walking into the room, we can see that the restored negotiating table is placed among them. In the middle, a long table is divided into five seats opposite each other. The two long tables in the north and South seem to support the balance of the negotiating table in the limited space. As a commentator, the officer introduced the process of the Korean War negotiations to the tourists at the negotiation table. Another group of tour guides served as interpreters. Subsequently, we visited the Armistice Agreement Signature Hall in the same courtyard. On the night before the signing of the armistice agreement, engineers and technicians from both sides of the DPRK and China miraculously built this wooden hall with Korean national characteristics. In the morning of July 27, 1953, more than 200 journalists from all over the world came to interview the truce negotiations to witness that historical moment. Walking into the hall, I saw two rectangular conference tables parallel to the north in the middle of the empty room, which were the signature tables of the chief representatives of the two sides at that time. In the middle of the conference table is a square table with signature texts. The tables are covered with green cloth. The flag of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea is standing on the conference table in the West and the United Nations flag is standing on the conference table in the east. Then we took another bus to Panmunjom, the "real" shop that we often see on TV, on the truce front. After the Korean Armistice, the two Koreas have built many buildings of a certain scale in this "common security area" and many famous talks between the two Koreas have been held here. We saw soldiers standing guard outside the Panfang Gate on the Korean side, while no one was seen on the Korean side, but more than a dozen cameras on the third floor platform of the tall building opposite were watching us attentively.
A nation's most bitter and bitter history, human society is always so tortuous here that we can witness the closest distance in the world, but the people in front of us have never said a word.

This historically significant place is the final truce agreement between China and North Korea and the United States. Such a historically important place can't see the traces of Chinese volunteer troops. North Korea has fully understood the traces of the volunteer army, unfortunately, Let the martyrs sleep.

Panmunjom is famous for the Korean Armistice Agreement signed here, originally just the name of a village. This is a testimony to the three-year tragic Korean War and a symbol of the national division of the Korean Peninsula. There is a meeting place for the Korean Armistice Negotiations to sign the Armistice Agreement. The meeting rooms of the Military Armistice Commission and the meeting rooms of the Neutral National Monitoring Committee are built along the demarcation line. The north and the South have their own guards along the demarcation line. Tourists visiting Panmunjom actually only visit the meeting room of the Military Armistice Commission. There is one at each end of the conference room. When our tourists enter the conference room, the other party's door will be closed. Our guards will stand in front of the door to prevent tourists from going out and entering each other. They are full of mystery. They are too strange to us, who have lived in a peaceful environment for a long time. They are also an education.

Under the "guard" of North Korean soldiers, I visited the Panmunjom Military Control Zone on the 38th line. There is the signing site of the armistice agreement between the north and south of North Korea. Three blue and a gray small house can be clearly seen on the two-story Panmunjom. In the middle of the house is a gray cement line representing the dividing line between the north and the south, with North Korea and US troops on guard, where Kim Jong-un was with South Korean President Moon Jae-in and US President Donald Trump. You can also see the South Korean tourist group pointing to the North Korean side, the tour guide is also working to explain what, the two sides are alerting each other and looking at each other through a line.

Reported a four-day tour group to North Korea, 3780 yuan per person, plus 200 yuan for military management, 80 yuan for tipping, a total of 4060 yuan per person. The so-called "military management fee" is the cost of defending our Korean People's Army when North Korea visits the military demarcation line. We were told that we were not allowed to bring mobile phones, laptops, and leave the scope of the hotel. I immediately realized that this is not to experience the feeling of being "double-standard" in China? It's worth a visit!

On the third day, we went to the military demarcation line 24 kilometers south of the 38th Line, which is what we usually call Panmendian. This may be our "major play" in North Korea this time. Unfortunately, in several buildings, we did not see "five-star red flag" nor the traces of the volunteers. It seems that the great achievements of "anti-American and aid to North Korea" are being forgotten. But we didn't make a fuss. We also felt the same way in Vietnam. In Hanoi Museum, we can't see any trace of China "Anti-American and Aid Vietnam". The world has only common interests, no common goals and "everything is in the silence".

The origin of "Panmundian": It was originally only a small mountain village, in order to facilitate the search of Chinese military representatives at that time, temporarily built a tavern and small grocery store with wooden boards near the meeting place, and hung the "Panmundian" written in Chinese characters for the logo, and the place has since been named Panmundian.

Just near the Panmunjom front, such a story happened. Zhang Shuliang, the second-level hero of the volunteer army. Jiading, the ordinary soldier of the 559th Regiment of the 187th Division of the 63rd Army, on the evening of April 30, 52. When he completed the surprise attack, he and another fighter accidentally rang the mine in order to rescue the wounded. The left leg and femur were blasted. Six wounds were hurt, but even then he let his comrades take the wounded away first and climb behind. Only a grenade was left, resting during the day and climbing at night! To climb a day of the river he spent one night, ten days and nine nights, several times unconscious, through the minefield barbed wire, clean up the pus wound and locusts. Finally, in the early morning of the tenth day, I saw my position! Later, Ba Jin wrote as a strong warrior

Strictly speaking, JOINT SECURITY AREA is the name of the land under our feet. The so-called Common Guard Zone refers to a circular area centered around the military demarcation line and about 800 meters in radius, guarded by the "United Nations Army" and the Korean Army. Both sides carry only self-defense weapons (I see that the people's soldiers here basically only carry pistols), but the friction has never stopped. From the famous war of cutting trees in 1976 and the penetration tunnel of Korea, both sides have been carrying only self-defense weapons. Korean actress Lee Ying-ai has also made films of the same name, reflecting the tension in the common security zone. From the signature hall to the building next to the 38th Line, the road is very narrow, with barbed wire everywhere, and huge cubic concrete piers hanging half over the edge of the road - it is said that once the war started, these cement piers could immediately be laid down, blocked the road and become roadblocks, similar to the "Longya" anti-tank piles used by German anti-tank forces in the late World War II.

The general feeling of coming here with the regiment today is that the whole itinerary is too tense and the atmosphere is very depressing. It's like being educated by revolutionary red. There are a lot of soldiers here. Photographs are very limited.
